intro: Hieracium garidelianum, commonly known as the Garidelian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium garidelianum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
